Anecia makes and peddles snacks like pancakes, hot cakes and rice cakes. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks .

Anecia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single.
 
Rogelio is providing motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 15 years. He requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

Rogelio has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rogelio hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for gasoline for his business

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Rosanna has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Rosanna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Lany

texts.en:
Lany is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Lany has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy stocks for the store and ingredients for making snacks.

Lany has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks for the store and ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Jeamar

texts.en:
Jeamar is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has one child. 

Jeamar provides motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for two years. He has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for his motorcycle services.

Jeamar has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, he hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for his motorcycle services

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Jenelyn has a shop that sells clothing like shirts, blouses and underwear. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy clothing like shirts, blouses and underwear to sell.

Jenelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing like shirts, blouses and underwear to sell

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramón tiene 35 años, está casado con la Sra. Mirta, ellos tiene dos hijos, quienes son los que motivan a la pareja a luchar.
Ramón es de profesión macatero (vendedor ambulante), empezó con la actividad  hace más de 15 años, por lo cual nos dice que cuenta con clientela formada, vende por la zona de Paraguarí.
El se define como una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que se esfuerza siempre el doble para poder dar a su familia todo lo que ellos necesitan para no tener que pasar por ningún tipo de privaciones.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de hebillas, prendas, frazadas y demás productos. Agradece a la fundación por la ayuda que le está dando, pues le será muy provechosa.
texts.en:
Ramón is 35 years old, and is married to Senora Mirta. They have two children, who are the motivation behind the couple's determination. Ramón is a professional macatero (street vendor). He began working in this way more than 15 years ago, and has a regular clientele in the Paraguarí area.
He defines himself as a hardworking and enterprising man, always striving to give his family everything they need and save them from any hardship.
The credit he is seeking is for the purchase of buckles, clothing, blankets and other products. He is grateful to the foundation for the help it is offering, which will be very beneficial.

loans.use: to buy buckles, clothing, blankets and other products

loans.name: Copo De Nieve Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “COPO DE NIEVE” iniciará su decimo quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Margui es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Comercio, producción, servicios y venta de manta de vicuña. 

La señora Margui indica que hace ocho ciclos que integra en Pro Mujer  ingresando por invitación de amigas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de mantas de manta de vicuña que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su suegra.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el crecimiento de su negocio (compra de mantas de vicuña) que adquirirá de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializara en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y capacitación.
texts.en:
The "Snowflake" communal bank is beginning its fifteenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer. It is composed of eight members and is headed by a board where Señora Margui is Secretary. The businesses operated by members of the communal bank are varied. Among them are: trade, production, services and the sale of vicuña blankets.

Señora Margui has been part of eight loan cycles with Pro Mujer, having got involved following an invitation by friends. Currently she has a business selling vicuña blankets. She has been in this line of work for many years, learning her trade from her mother in law.

The loan will help her to grow her business, by buying vicuña fleeces in El Alto. When she has woven the wool into blankets she sells them on her stall. This workflow allows her to generate income to help support her family, as she is married and has one son.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the work they do on ​​health, and the training they provide.

loans.use: To buy vicuña fleeces

loans.name: Thuan

texts.en:
Thuan, a 49-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two children. She and her husband earn a living running a general store that sells a variety of basic goods to people in the local community.

Thuan requests a loan to purchase more products such as soaps, candies, toilet paper, and shampoo to stock her store. This will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she hopes she can earn additional income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase more products such as soaps, candies, toilet paper, and shampoo to stock her store

loans.name: Genita

texts.en:
Genita is 40 years old, married to Henry, and blessed with five children ages 20, 18, 15, 13 and 10 years, respectively. She owns rental houses, a business she started six years ago, and earns a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

She has requested a loan for 40,000 KES to purchase bricks for constructing more rental houses. The profit earned will be put back into her business. Her dream is to live a happy life. This is her second loan.

loans.use: to purchase bricks for constructing more rental houses.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia lives in Yei. She sells food and has been in business for four years. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children, three of whom are still in school. 

Emelia heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 700 South Sudanese pounds (SDG) in order to purchase sugar and oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and oil for sale.

loans.name: Rebelyn

texts.en:
Rebelyn is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Rebelyn has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Rebelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Rebelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for sale.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 20 years old and a single mother of a three year old child.

Naomi operates a retail stall selling various items like wallets, caps, and belts. She has been running this business for the last three years, making a monthly income of 6,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy a stock of sunglasses, belts and caps for sale. Her profits will be used to repay the loan.

Her dream is to have a big clothing business in Kisumu town.

loans.use: to buy a stock of sunglasses, belts and caps and for sale.

loans.name: Lilly

texts.en:
Lilly lives in Yei. She sells charcoal and has been in business for four years. She is 36 year olds, married, and has four children, two of whom are still in school. 

Lilly heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 700 South Sudanese pounds (SDG) in order to purchase charcoal.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Someth

texts.en: Someth, 33, is married and resides with her parents, her husband, and two children in Battambang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for over ten years, earning approximately $6 USD per day. Her husband is a motor taxi driver who earns approximately $5 USD per day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Someth is requesting a loan of $500 USD to purchase more groceries to sell in order to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to use further profits to expand her business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger and to provide comfortable living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, in order to generate more income to supporting her family.

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en: Sokhorn, 55, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is a carpenter who earns approximately $5 USD per day. One of her children is employed in the garment factory and earns about $3 USD per day. She wants to build a new house. With this goal in mind, Sokhom is requesting a loan of $700 USD to purchase timber for constructing her house. In the future, she would like to expand her husband's business.

loans.use: to purchase timber for constructing her house

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives in Yei. She runs a food stall, and has been in business for four years. She is 35 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are still in school. 

Agnes heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan for 700 South Sudanese pounds (SDG) in order to purchase onions and tomatoes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for school fees.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes & onions for sale.

loans.name: Salwa

texts.en:
Salwa is a 62-year-old widow. Two years ago she opened a small cosmetics and accessories shop to spend her free time and make her own living.

Salwa used to be a school manager, but she retired at the age of 60. She couldn't imagine herself without work, so she opened her own small business. Salwa is a hardworking woman. She was responsible of raising her daughter since her husband passed away. She did quite a good job.

To improve her business, Salwa applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her business capital with special accessories, cosmetics and perfumes. Salwa is very sure that this loan will help in fulfilling her customers' needs and desires.

She hopes to stay in good health and to continue making a living without asking for others' help.

loans.use: to increase her business capital with special accessories, cosmetics and perfumes

loans.name: Redentor

texts.en:
This is Redentor, 37, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is a widower with one child. He manages their household while operating a business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Redentor operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 Philippine pesos (PHP) worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a loan for 12,000 PHP. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Redentor hopes to be able to expand soon. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Secundina

texts.es:
La Sra. Secundina es de la ciudad de Concepción, tiene 52 años, es separada con 6 hijos, 3 varones y 3 mujeres todos/as ya son adultos y todos trabajan. La señora es muy trabajadora tiene su establecimiento en una comunidad en donde tiene sus animales vacunos y sus cultivos.
Según cuenta la señora le fue muy difícil criar y educar a todos sus hijos, ya que ella se encontraba solo, pero gracias al esfuerzo y empeño que ella y sus otros hijos pusieron, supieron salir adelante y en la actualidad la mayoría de sus hijos ya son profesionales. Ella es una mujer muy luchadora y trabajadora, que toda su vida se ha esforzado por darle a su familia lo mejor.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de ganado para la cría, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia. Está muy contenta con la ayuda de fundación paraguaya y kiva le dan.
texts.en:
Sra. Secundina hails from the city of Concepción. She is 52 years old and is separated from her partner. She has 6 grown-up children: 3 men and 3 women who all work. The Señora is an entrepreneurial lady who works in the community, where she has raises cows and grows crops.
The Señora tells us that it was difficult for her to raise and educate all her children as she was on her own but, owing to the efforts and determination of herself and her other children, she managed to get by. Today, the majority of her children are now professional people. She is a strong-spirited, hard-working lady who has spent her life working hard to provide the best that she can for her family.
She is applying for this loan to buy livestock to raise so that she can continue working and helping her family. She is very happy with the support provided by the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Salasala Group

texts.en:
Said, who is in his early 50s, is married with four children, one of whom goes to school. The rest are grownups.  He has a kiosk where he sells sodas, juice, milk and bites like cakes, mandazi and chapati. He works from 2.00 pm to midnight daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his 14th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to open a kiosk, bought a motorcycle, put a ceiling board in his house, managed to take care of his family and school fees and has paid back all his loans successfully.  He wants a loan to buy a sack of Irish potatoes.  His dream is to one day be able to finish renovating his house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Salasala", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy one sack of irish potatoes.

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc is 30 years old and married. Her husband earns a living working as a mason. They have three children and live with them in Ho Chi Minh City.

Ngoc earns an income to support her family by running a store that sells food. She intends to use her loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic foods to sell from her store.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of basic foods to sell from her store

loans.name: Jorleny Isabel

texts.es: Jorleny Isabel tiene 27 años de edad, su actividad a la que se dedica es a la venta de cosméticos y ropa, esta joven emprendedora  ya tiene años de estar en este negocio en el cual tiene varios clientes a quienes le  ofrece su producto, esta actividad  la realiza de forma ambulante. Jorleny tiene un hijo a su cargo en el cual lucha cada día para darle lo mejor, esta emprendedora está solicitando financiamiento para comprar  polvo, ropa,  prendas de Oro y cosméticos entre otros pedidos que le solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jorleny Isabel, 27 years old, sells cosmetics and clothing. This young entrepreneur has already been running this business for a few years, and she has various clients who buy her products whenever she is out peddling her wares.
Jorleny is raising her son, and she struggles each day to provide the best that she can for him. This entrepreneur is seeking financial support to buy powders, clothing, gold jewellery and cosmetics among other products which her clients have requested from her.

loans.use: to purchase powders, clothing, gold jewellery and cosmetics among other products which have been ordered by her clients.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with six children. 

Emma has a corn farm where she harvests & sells rice grains during harvest time. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for 25,000 PHP to buy fertilizers for the corn fields.

Emma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Emma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her corn fields

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Victoria has a shop that makes & sells snacks like pancakes & rice cakes. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

Victoria has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Victoria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make snacks

loans.name: Than

texts.en:
Than, 38, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She and her husband have been involved in the agricultural business for over five years, they have extensive experience and are successful in their careers.

They are involved in growing rice and vegetables to sell. Additionally, her husband runs a fishing business to generate extra income to support the family. 

They earn approximately USD 10 per day. Due to the lack of funds, Than is requesting for a loan of USD 600 to purchase fertilizer and fuel to use in her farming work for growing rice in the dry season. 

In the future, she would like to run a poultry farm and help her children get a bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it stronger, to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and fuel to use in her farming work for growing rice in the dry season

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
This is Rhodora, she is 50 and a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Dionisio, an employee and mother to their two children. 

She, together with her husband, manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide an income for their everyday expenses.

Rhodora operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, Php 5 worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. 

Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rhodora dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. 

She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 32 years old, married to Geoffrey and blessed with three children aged 16, 14 and three years old respectively. She is a tailor, this is a business she ventured into 14 years ago and she earns a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

She has requested a loan of KES 30,000, which she will use to purchase three rolls of cloth material, five bundles of thread and a sewing machine. 

The profit she earns from this business would help her expand her business and pay school fees. Her dream is to one day practice sugarcane farming, this is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase three rolls of cloth material, five bundles of thread and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Yei and sells fish. She has been in this business for three years. She is 30 years old, married and has four children; three of whom are still in school. 

Joyce heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 700 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Ekaale

texts.en:
Ekaale is 41 years old, married to Ayanae and blessed with three children aged 15, 10 and seven years respectively. 

He sells charcoal, a business he started five years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 10,200. He has requested a loan worth KES 40,000 to purchase more sacks of charcoal for sale. 

The profit earned will be ploughed back into his business. His dream is to see his business expand as well as to educate his children in good schools. This is his second loan.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Zaiton

texts.en:
Zaiton sells food in a stall and has been in business for four years. She is 38-years-old, married, and has five children; three of them are still in school. 

Zaiton heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 600 SDG in order to purchase onions and  tomatoes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase onions and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
This is Elena, 51, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Miguelito, a vendor, and is a mother to her five children. She, together with her husband, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Elena operates a buy-and-sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and then sells the items with a little profit. Her products are men's and women’s clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy RTW products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Elena hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: Siyon

texts.en:
Siyon, 32, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She has been involved in growing vegetables to sell for over two years, earning approximately USD 3 day. 

Her husband has a motor taxi and earns approximately USD 5 per day. Her husband wants to run a delivery service. With this goal in mind, Siyon is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a trailer for her husband to run the service. 

This purchase would enable her husband to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and stronger to provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a trailer for her husband to run the delivery service

loans.name: Sory

texts.en:
Sory, 33, is married, resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for over five years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. Additionally, he grows rice to generate more income to support the family. Approximately, he earns USD 5 a day. 

Since the present motor is too old, Sory is requesting for a loan of USD 900 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run his transportation service. This purchase would enable her husband to attract more customers and generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger and help her children get bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run his transportation service

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
This is Jonalyn, 21, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is single and she manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 
 
Jonalyn operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of Php 16,000. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Jonalyn hopes to grow the business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani lives in Yei. She sells foodstuffs and has been in this business for four years. She is 35 years old, married and has four children; three of whom are still in school. 

Amani heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase sugar and oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and oil for sale.

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Soeurn, 49, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She has been selling groceries for over ten years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker and earns approximately USD 3 per day. Three of her children are employed in the garment factory. They earn about USD 9 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Soeurn is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more groceries to sell, in order to generate extra profit for the family. 

In the future, she would like to use the extra profit to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and stronger to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, in order to generate extra profit for the family.

loans.name: Coca Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “COCA” iniciará su cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Patacamaya, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva de la cual la señora Madelinne es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, venta de celulares, venta de cosméticos

La señora Madelinne  indica que es el cuarto ciclo que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio que viene trabajando hace años atrás.

El préstamo que sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de abarrotes) que adquirirá de su comunidad y posteriormente lo venderá en su lugar de comercio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en salud.
texts.en:
The "COCA" Communal Association is beginning its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Patacamaya Regional Centre. This group is made up of 9 members and is run by a committee which is headed by their President, Madelinne. The businesses run by the Communal Association members are quite varied and include: a local shop, mobile phone sales, and cosmetic sales.

Madelinne tells us that this is her fourth cycle with Pro Mujer and that she joined the institution by invitation from a promoter. Currently she is running a local shop and has been doing so for many years now.

She is applying for this loan to be able to increase her stock (to buy general groceries) which she will purchase within her community and later sell them in her place of business. This work allows her to earn more for her family - she lives with her partner and 2 children.

When asked, she tells us that she likes Pro Mujer and she likes the healthcare support she also receives from them.

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn, she is 41 and a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Allan, a machinist, and mother to their children. 

She, together with her husband and children, manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marilyn operates a computer rental shop. In the Philippines, very few people own their own computers. Thus there is a need for them, especially for students, who need to do their research and papers. She rents out computers by the hour and offers printing and typing services. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy new computer units, spare parts and accessories needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Marilyn hopes to have her own place of business and dreams of being able to give her children a good future and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and were she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business

loans.name: Pha

texts.en:
Pha, 31, is single and resides with his parents in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

He has been a motor mechanic as well as an arc welder for over two years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. 

In order to improve his business, Pha is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more steel to use in his welding business. This would enable him to have enough steel to make steel constructions, such as roofs, windows and doors. 

In the future, he would like to expand his business and build a new house to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase steel for constructing steel objects, such as roofs, doors and windows.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in Yei, she sells foodstuffs and has been in this business for five years. She is 40 years old, married and has six children, four of whom are still in school. 

Esther heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 700 SDG in order to purchase sugar and coffee. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and coffee for sale.

loans.name: Boudissi Cécile's Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FIFAME est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Boudissi Cécile, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Boudissi Cécile est âgée de 32 ans et est  mariée à un certain Rufin. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Boudissi Cécile vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Il y a une dizaine d’année que Boudissi Cécile mène comme activité, la vente des produits divers (sucre, bissap, chaussures, etc.) dans une ville du Bénin. De façon secondaire, Boudissi Cécile vend des friperies et des cartes de recharges téléphoniques. Boudissi Cécile s'approvisionne au Benin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire, Boudissi Cécile sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe FIFAME, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
FIFAME Group is made up of three persons who live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, named Boudissi Cécile, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. Sh'es 32 years old and married to one Rufin. The couple has three children who all attend school, and whom they have to support.

Boudissi Cécile lives together with her husband and children. Together with her husband, she ensures that the various expenses of the family are covered. For about ten years, she's been selling various products (sugar, hibiscus, shoes, etc.) in one of Benin's town.

As a secondary business, she also sells secondhand clothing and mobile phone recharge cards. She gets her supplies in Benin.

In order to satisfy her clientele and increase her revenue, Boudissi Cécile, together with the other members of the group, is seeking a third loan from Kiva's parter, ALIDé. The previous two loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing, shoes, sugar, and hibiscus leaves

loans.name: Ami De Jesus Group

texts.fr: AMI DE JESUS est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres habitent dans le même quartier au Benin. La représentante du groupe du nom de Gandjo Médédomè Carine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgé de 29 ans.  Gandjo Médédomè Carine ne vit plus avec son mari, mais a un enfant qui est scolarisé et à sa charge. Gandjo Médédomè Carine vit seule avec son enfant et assure seule les charges de la maison. Gandjo Médédomè Carine a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Gandjo Médédomè Carine mène comme activité  la vente d'ustensiles de cuisine (assiettes, glacières, etc.) et des cartes de recharges téléphoniques dans une ville du Benin. Gandjo Médédomè Carine s’approvisionne au Benin et parfois au Togo. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse, Gandjo Médédomè Carine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AMI DE JESUS, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
AMI DE JESUS Group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group's representative, named Gandjo Médédomè Carine, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's 29 years old and doesn't live with her husband anymore, but has one school-attending child to support.

She lives alone with her child and ensures that the various household expenses are covered on her own. She dropped out of elementary school. To provide for herself, she sells kitchenware (plates, iceboxes, etc.) and phone recharge cards in one of Benin's towns. She gets her supplies in Benin, and sometimes in Togo.

In order to better meet an ever-increasing customer demand, Gandjo Médédomè Carine, together with the other members of the group, is seeking a second loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé. The first loan was repaid without problem.

loans.use: to buy kitchenware and phone recharge cards

loans.name: Leonido

texts.es:
El Sr. Leonido es de la ciudad de Itá, esta acompañado desde hace varios años, tiene 5 hijos, dos de los cuales son mayores, y cada uno se encuentra en sus respectivas obligaciones.
El Sr.Leonido se dedica a la compra y venta de carbón y coco desde hace más de 12 años, actividad que realiza con 2 de sus hijos menores, es una persona muy sacrificada y trabajadora, que desea poder ayudar a su familia a progresar y salir adelante. Su deseo es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de carbón, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Está muy contento con la ayuda de fundación paraguaya y de kiva.
texts.en:
Leonido is from the city of Itá.  He lives with his partner and has five children, two of whom are adults and take care of themselves.

Leonido has been buying and selling charcoal and coconuts for more than 12 years.  He carries out this business with his two younger children.  He is a very selfless and hard-working person who would like to be able to help his family make progress and get ahead in life.  His wish is to continue growing in his business so that he can continue helping his family.

Leonido is requesting a loan to buy charcoal to stock his business and meet his customers' demands.  He is very happy to receive the help of Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to re-sell

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es:
El Señor Dionisio tiene 59 años de edad,  está casado y tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales uno vive aún con él. Dionisio es macatero (vendedor ambulante), ejerció la profesión desde que se casó, sus recorridos lo hace en la zona metropolitana, específicamente en la ciudad de San Lorenzo y alrededores.
Es un señor muy emprendedor, y gracias a su trabajo pudo lograr que a sus hijos a estudien y así puedan terminar sus carreras. Los mismos son ya profesionales recibidos docentes al igual que de su madre que es docente jubilada.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de productos como: hamacas, sobrecamas, etc.  así podrá cumplir con  la demanda que tiene  de dichos productos por parte de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dionisio is 59 years old, married, and has four children, only one of whom still lives with him.  Dionisio is a 'macatero' (traveling salesman).  He has been in this trade since he got married.  He travels around the metropolitan area, specifically the city of San Lorenzo and its surrounding areas.

Dionisio is a very entrepreneurial gentleman and, thanks to his work, he has been able to allow his children to study and finish their degrees.  They are now professionals (teachers) just like their mother who is a retired teacher.

Dionisio is requesting this loan to buy products such as hammocks, bedspreads, etc. so that he can meet the demand that he has for these products from his customers.

loans.use: to buy hammocks, bedspreads, etc.

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr: En bon fils de paysan, Abdou a hérité de son métier d’agriculteur de son père et de ses ancêtres. Actuellement il est à 12 ans d’expérience. Abdou est marié et père de famille. Avec le prêt demandé il va acheter  des semences de choux et des intrants agricoles. Il assure la dépense quotidienne de son foyer grâce aux revenus de son activité. Dans les soucis de diversifier les produits et services, il souhaite un jour ouvrir une boutique pour vendre des produits agricoles.  Et comme cela tout ce dont il aura besoin pour son exploitation sera à sa disposition et réussira t-il à créer une entreprise familial dans le domaine de l’agriculture.
texts.en: As the good son of a peasant, Abdou has inherited his profession as a farmer from his father and his ancestors. He currently has 12 years' experience. Abdou is married and a father. With the loan he has requested he is going to buy cabbage seeds and agricultural inputs. He covers his daily household expenses with the income he makes from his activity. With a view to diversifying both products and services he would like to open a shop one day to sell agricultural products. By doing that he will have everything he needs for his own farming activity and he will be able to create a family agricultural business.

loans.use: to buy cabbage seeds and agricultural inputs, inlcuding fertilizers, fuel oil and manure

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La señora Ana es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, es soltera, tiene 30 años de edad,  y vive con sus padres. Es docente, enseña  en el  turno mañana, además es propietaria de una Perfumería que esta ubicado en su domicilio, realiza venta de Perfumes y cosméticos importados al contado y a créditos. Cuenta con clientela formada y buenas ventas por la facilidad que ofrece a todos sus clientes. Empezó su perfumería con un ahorro que tenia, luego lo fue ampliando con un crédito de la Fundación Paraguaya para ampliar su stock, con la cual está teniendo buenos resultados.
Esta vez solicita el crédito nuevamente para poder surtir su negocio con más variedades de perfumes y cosméticos, con lo que podrá seguir trabajando y ofreciendo buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ana is from the city of Curuguaty.  She is 30 years old, single, and lives with her parents.  She is a teacher who teaches mornings.  She also owns a perfume store which is located in her home.  Ana sells imported perfumes and cosmetics for cash and on credit.  She has an established customer base and makes good sales because of the terms that she offers all her customers.  She started her perfume store with some savings that she had, then gradually expanded it with loans from Fundación Paraguaya, expanding her stock.  This is making her good profits.

On this occasion, Ana is requesting a new loan so that she can stock her business with a wider variety of perfumes and cosmetics.  This will enable her to continue working and offer a good variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy perfume to re-sell

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina es un mujer de 45 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su tienda su historia empezó por iniciativa propia de ver que no tenia ingresos decidió poner una tienda pequeña donde vende papeleria, frutas, dulces, confites, galletas etc. Su trabajo lo hace sola de las 6:30 hasta las 8:00, no tiene dificultades, está casada el esposo es mecánico, si tiene 2 hijos, su sueño más importante es incrementar su tienda y surtirlo más. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su tienda y asi comprar frutas, papeleria, confites.
texts.en:
Reina is a 45-year-old woman who has a great desire to make progress in her store over the next few years.

Reina started her business on her own initiative when she saw that she had no income.  She decided to set up a small store where she sells fruit, candies, confectionery, cookies, etc.  She works alone from 6.30am to 8.00pm and does not experience any problems.  She is married and her husband is a mechanic.  She has two children.

Reina's biggest dream is to expand her store and stock it some more.  She would like this loan for her store so that she can buy fruit, stationery products and confectionery.

loans.use: to buy fruit, stationery products and confectionery

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
El señor Faustino es de la ciudad de coronel Oviedo, se dedica al Moto taxi. Es soltero, trabaja hace 4 años de taxista, vivía en la campaña con sus padres y se decidió a venir a vivir en la ciudad pensando en el progreso suyo y el de su familia.
Comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado porque en las épocas de invierno tiene que pasar por muchos obstáculos debido a que tiene menos pasajeros porque hace mucho frio. Su sueño es comprar más motos para trabajar y así progresar cada día más.
El solicita el crédito para comprar repuestos para su mototaxi, ya que este es su medio esencial de trabajo, está contento por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Faustino is from the city of Coronel Oviedo, he drives a motorcycle taxi. He is single and has worked as a taxi driver for 4 years. He lived with his parents and decided to come live in the city, thinking of his own progress and that of his family.  

He remarks that his job is very difficult because during the winter he has a lot of obstacles since he has fewer passengers since it's cold. His dream is to buy more motorcycles to work and thus progress ore every day. 

He is asking for the loan to buy replacement parts for his motorcycle taxi, since it is an essential part of his job. He is happy with opportunity that he is receiving.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Rosales Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSALES” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Villa Tejada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Teresa es una socia de base. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: cría de animales, agricultura de verduras, venta de carne, venta de carne, tienda de barrio.

La señora Teresa,  indica que hace cinco meses que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción de verduras que viene trabajando hace años, mismo que aprendió de sus padres.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de semillas y abono) que adquiere de La Paz  y posteriormente a la producción lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio de salud.
texts.en:
The 'Rosales' community bank are about to begin their second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Tejada regional office.  The group has eight members and is run by a board of directors of which Teresa a key member.  The businesses that the women are engaged in are varied and include: raising animals, growing vegetables, selling meat and running a neighborhood store.

Teresa says that she has been working with Pro Mujer for five months, having joined the institution through an invitation from a loan officer.  She has a business producing vegetables which she has worked in for years.  She learned this business from her parents.

Teresa is requesting this loan to increase her capital.  She will buy seeds and fertilizer in La Paz and then, after she has grown her crops, she will sell them from her sales stall.  This work allows her to make income with which to support her family.  Teresa lives with her common-law husband and has two children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Teresa replied that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Jeanett Elissa

texts.es: Janette Elissa es una emprendedora que se le ha apoyado en el financiamiento en la compra de productos para el negocio que es la elaboración y venta de adornos y piñatas y refrescos, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación donde la visitan sus clientes. La emprendedora inicia su negocio de la necesidad de generar ingreso y apoyar en los gastos del hogar, y sacar a su hijo adelante, ella ya ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000 lo cual ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con buenos valores. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para comprar globos, adornos, calcomanías, frutas para refrescos entre otros productos.
texts.en: Janette Elissa is an entrepreneur who has received previous loans to buy products for her business making and selling decorations, piñatas and soft drinks.  Her business is located in her home and this is where her customers come to buy.  She started her business as she needed to make an income, help with her household expenses and provide for her son.  Since she has been working with Fundación León 2000, she has shown herself to be a responsible person.  She is currently requesting a loan to buy balloons, decorations, decals and fruit for making soft drinks,etc.

loans.use: to buy balloons, decorations, decals, fruit for making soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Flor De Rosa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE ROSA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Santiago II, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Rufina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa interior, venta de salchipapa, venta de arena lavada, venta de polleras y faldas, venta de tejidos.

La señora Rufina,  indica que es un año que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de unas amigas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de chompas y mantas que viene trabajando hace algún tiempo, aprendiendo el mismo en una empresa donde prestaba labores.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio comercial. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.

En la fotografía no se encuentra la señora elvira por razones culturales.
texts.en:
The “FLOR DE ROSA” communal bank will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer, as a part of the Santiago II center. It is made up of six members and is led by a board of directors headed by Rufina. The members' businesses in the communal bank are varied. Among them are: selling underwear, selling salchipapas, selling washed sand, selling skirts and selling weaving.  

Rufina indicates that she has been working with Pro Mujer for a year and joined the institution when she was invited by one of her friends. At present, she has a knitting business selling sweaters and blankets. She has been doing this for awhile, having learned at a business where she used to work.  

The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital. She will buy wool that she will acquire at fairs and later sell in her commercial space. This work allows her to generate resources to support her family. She is married and has three children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health aspects.  

In the photograph Elvira is not shown for cultural reasons.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Lucia Libertad

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Pedro se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio del mismo nombre en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Lucia, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo  de  17 años  de edad, el cual este año ingresa a la universidad.  Su esposo realiza mantenimiento a los barcos.

Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres días a la semana en sus entregas y cobros ya que  deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. También los días sabados y domingos instala un pequeño local en su casa en el cual vende deliciosos ceviches y encebollados de pescado lo cual le deja muy buenos ingresos en estos días. Tiene más de 10  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, pescado y otros víveres para preparar los alimentos. Lleva 10 años en el Banco Comunal, es la presidenta del mismo y está muy orgullosa de su grupo por que es muy cumplido.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the 'San Pedro' community bank meet in the neighborhood of the same name, in the city of Manta.  This city is well known for its beautiful beaches which are very popular year round.  It is a city with many tourist attractions and a beauty which is second to none.

Here we meet Lucia.  Lucia is 47 years old, married, and has a 17-year-old son who is entering university this year.  Her husband carries out maintenance work on boats.

Lucia is a housewife who, in order to make her own income and help her husband with the household expenses, sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She makes her sales door to door.  She works three days a week delivering her products and collecting payment as she leaves her products on credit and collects payment every week.  On Saturdays and Sundays, she sets up a small area in her home where she sells delicious 'ceviche' (a marinated fish dish) and 'encebollados de pescado' (a type of fish stew) which makes her very good income.  She has been in this business for more than ten years and is doing very well.

Lucia is requesting this loan to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, fish and other supplies she needs for making her food.  She has been a member of her community bank for ten years and is the bank's president.  She is very proud of her group because it is an excellent group.

Lucia's dream is to own a large restaurant.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, fish and other supplies for making food

loans.name: Wilma Colombia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Pedro se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio del mismo nombre en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Wilma, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada hace varios años pero no ha podido tener  hijos. Su esposo es chofer.
 
Ella es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa y de productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella sale a recorrer  tres días a la semana aunque también vende en su casa a la hora que sus clientes deseen una prenda, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 12 años que se dedica a esta actividad, ella también cose ropa pues aprendió corte y confección hace varios años atrás.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa en general. Lleva 17 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que le brinda el banco.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y en su vida.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the 'San Pedro' community bank meet in the neighborhood of the same name, in the city of Manta.  This city is well known for its beautiful beaches which are very popular year round.  It is a city which has a lot of tourist attractions and a beauty which is second to none.

Here we meet Wilma.  Wilma is 42 years old.  She has been married for several years but has not been able to have children.  Her husband is a driver.

Wilma is a housewife who, in order to make her own income and help her husband with the household expenses, sells clothing and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and ladies' accessories).  She goes out to sell her products three days a week, though she also sells from her home whenever her customers want to buy something.  She leaves her products with her customers on credit and collects payment every week.  She has been in this business for more than twelve years and she also sews clothing as she learned dressmaking some years ago.

Wilma will use this loan to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and clothing.  She has been a member of her community bank for 17 years and she likes it because of the benefits provided by the bank.

Wilma's dreams are to make progress in her business and in her life.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and clothing

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: Cándida Rosa esta emprendedora se dedica a su negocio que es una librería que la tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación  donde atiende a sus clientes que le solicitan los productos. Ella ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, en el crédito otorgado anteriormente realizo las compras de productos para la librería. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de productos como fólder, lápiz de grafitos, hojas en blanco, borradores, lapicero, regla, engrapadoras, pega, cartulina entre otros productos.
texts.en: Cándida Rosa is an entrepreneur that sells supplies out of her home to customers that come looking for items to buy. She has worked with Fundación León 2000 before, having received a prior loan to stock her store. Now she seeks credit to buy materials for her business such as folders, pencils, paper, erasers, pens, rulers, staplers, glue and other items.

loans.use: to buy folders, pencils, paper, erasers, pens, rulers, staplers, glue and other items

loans.name: Viviana Guadalupe

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Pedro se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio del mismo nombre en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Viviana, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 10, 3 y de 1 año  de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela.  Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa, carteras, zapatos y  productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella sale a recorrer  todos días unas tres horas diarias, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Sus productos los compra en una distribuidora en Portoviejo cada vez que necesita mercadería. Tiene más de 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad, ella siempre vende productos o prendas que estén de moda ya que es lo mas salida tiene.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatillas, carteras, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Lleva 7 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que  le brinda el banco y sus amigas.
 
Su sueño es tener un local propio.
texts.en:
The San Pedro communal bank meets every two weeks in the neighborhood of the same name in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches which are visited frequently all year round and for being a city with unequaled beauty and many tourist attractions.

Here we meet Viviana. She is 31 years old, married, and has three children aged 10, 3 and 1 years old. The oldest is in school. Her husband is a fisherman. 

She is a housewife who to get her own resources and to help her husband with household expenses sells clothes, purses, shoes and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories). She goes out every day for three hours, sells her products on credit and collects every week. She buys her products at a distributor in Portoviejo every time she needs merchandise. She has been doing this activity for more than 7 years and always sell products or items of clothing that are in style since those are the most popular. 

This loan is to buy clothes, slippers, purses, perfumes, creams and cosmetics. She has been in the communal bank for 7 years and she likes it for the help that the bank gives her and her friends. 
 
Her dream is to have her own locale.

loans.use: to buy clothes, slippers, purses, creams, perfume and cosmetics.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
This is Juanita, 43, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Francis, a driver.   Juanita and her husband operate the business while managing their own household.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Juanita operates a variety store.  In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood.  It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Juanita hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en: Salim is requesting another Kiva loan of KES 50,000 to boost on his charcoal selling business. With the loan, he wants to purchase sacks of charcoal and establish a retail shop business, purchase shop items, like wheat flour, maize and sugar.  He dreams of owning a motor vehicle for the transportation business in future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Khanh

texts.en:
Khanh, 53 years old, is married and has three children, two sons and one daughter. She and her husband support their family through the income they earn from making iron latches. They began this business ten years ago. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Khanh intends to take a loan to buy a large quantity of iron. The additional materials will enable her to increase her production and sales of latches. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy iron to produce latches.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Yei, she is 33 year old, married, and has four children, three of them are still in school.   Rose sells food at a food stall.  She has been in business for four years. 

Rose heard about BRAC South Sudan from credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of 700SDG in order to purchase beans and rice.   She will use the extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for her food stall.

loans.name: Nguyet

texts.en:
Nguyet is 45 years old and married with three children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City.  Her husband earns income as a driver for hire.  Nguyet runs a cafe to earn a living. 

She started her business ten years ago.  With this loan, she intends to offer a variety of beverages for her customers at the cafe, and gradually expand her business.  She hopes her business runs smoothly and help improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a variety of beverages for her cafe.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita, 55, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Fernando, a technician.   Teresita and her husband, manage their own household while operating the business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Teresita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She also operate a copier machine and offer school supplies for additional income. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php27,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Teresita hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items and more inventory for her store.

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van, 40, is married and has two children.  She lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City.  Her husband is a driver for hire.

Van has been running a beauty shop and a general store in front of her house for four years.  She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety and quantity of basic products to stock her general store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: To increase the variety and quantity of inventory for her general store.

loans.name: Luong

texts.en:
Luong, 59, is married and has four children, one son and three daughters.  She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.  Luong and her husband earn an income running a generel store in front of their house. 

She started this business thirty years ago.  She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a variety of food and beverages, to stock her store.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 33-year-old married man with five children, all of whom are enrolled in school. His wife's name is Nzadze and she works as a farmer, while Patrick has been operating a retail shop business for six years, his primary customers passersby and neighbours. Patrick's other source of income is charcoal-selling. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water, and his highest monthly expense is food. His greatest business challenge is the high cost of transportation.

Patrick joined Yehu to access capital and is now requesting a loan of Kes 50,000 to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, cooking fat oil and rice. He aspires to establish a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, cooking fat oil and rice.

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Sulaiman.  He is married and has 1 child, age 3 yrs. He has 1 additional dependent who lives with him.  In 1999, Sulaiman established his textiles business. He began his business because at the age of 19 years he went to one of the diamond mining towns known as Kono. However, due to the rebel war in Sierra Leone, they were attacked by rebels, and he fled to Makeni where he started doing petty business with the small amount of money he had by then. 

After some years when the business developed, he decided to come to Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone, to continue his business until now. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Suliaman requires a loan in order to buy one bundled bail of cotton @ Le 4,500,000. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 1,000,000. 

In the future, Sulaiman plans to build a house so that he can live comfortably with his family, and he hopes to see his children educated to university level. He thanks you for your help.

loans.use: to buy one bundled bail of cotton.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
This is Emma, 54, resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Manuel, her business partner, and is the mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Emma operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 38,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Emma hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Nhanh

texts.en:
Nhanh is fifty-one years old and is married. She has four children and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City.

She has run a general store at her hourse for thirteen years. She sells milk, beverages, stationery, and confectionery. She intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of products to sell from her store, such as eggs, sugar, and sanitation items.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy many kinds of products such as eggs, sugar, and sanitation items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es: María de cincuenta años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo. Ella posee una venta de relojes y lentes de forma ambulante que hace en diferentes zonas cercanas a la que vive, además elabora y vende jarabes medicinales naturales, es muy conocida en la zona y se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues todo lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad y a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable; María es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante siempre aprovecha todas las oportunidades que se le presentan, piensa que al cosechar una idea se cosecha un deseo; quiere ver crecer su negocio y está dispuesta a trabajar duro para lograrlo, es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar relojes, lentes, materia prima para los jarabes entre otros. María tiene la confianza que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en: 50-year-old María lives with her life partner and child.  She has a business selling watches and lenses as an itinerant vendor.  She sells in nearby areas.  She also makes and sells natural medicinal syrups.  She is very well known in her area and has a lot of customers because everything she sells is very good quality and she sells at really affordable prices.  In addition, her customer service is second to none.  María is an entrepreneurial woman who has a great desire to do well in life.  She always makes the most of every opportunity that comes along.  She believes that in harvesting an idea you are harvesting a desire.  María would like to see her business grow and is ready to work hard to achieve this.  She is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy watches, lenses, and supplies for making her syrups.  She is certain that this will enable her to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy watches, lenses and supplies for making syrups

loans.name: Alba Esperanza

texts.es: Alba Esperanza su negocio al que se dedica es a dar los servicios de transporte ya tiene años de tener este negocio en lo cual brindado a sus hijos lo mejor. Esta emprendedora ya ha trabajado con Fundación León 2000 lo cual ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con buenos valores y mantiene un record crediticio intachable. Actualmente Alba Esperanza está solicitando financiamiento para realizarle algunas mejoras a su taxi que posee como las compras de llantas, gasolina, y realizar las mejoras a su unidad.
texts.en: Alba Esperanza's business is providing a transport service.  She has been in this business for years and it has enabled her to provide for her children.  This entrepreneur has already worked with Fundación León 2000.  She has shown herself to be a responsible person and has an impeccable repayment history.  Alba Esperanza is currently requesting a loan to make some improvements to her taxi.  She will buy tires and gas, and make some improvements.

loans.use: to buy tires and gas, and to make some improvements to her vehicle

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en: Ivan is a forty-year-old hardworking man with seven children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been a farmer for the last ten years, and his major hardships have been high transportation costs and inadequate capital to purchase enough feeds. However, he has a goal of hiring employees to help expand his business and increasing the number of pigs. Ivan needs a loan to buy timber and cement to use in the construction of his modern pigsty.

loans.use: to buy timber and cement for constructing a modern pigsty.

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en:
Ngan is 58 years old and is widowed. She has been running a cafe and a general store in front of her door for 22 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and raise her two children. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.
