Sauline is 38 years old married to Edward who contributes to the family income. She supports five members of her  family. She has been running he salon for a period of about 10 years with a monthly income of 10,000 kenya shillings.

This is her fifth loan in KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous ones. She wants to use the loan to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to expand her business and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Fe Y Amor 4 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group Fe y Amor 4 (Faith and Love). The group is located in Santiago, the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic and known for its tobacco and beef production. The group members are dedicated to selling clothes, food, shoes and jewelry.

Maria, who lives in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their child, is dedicated to working hard and helping her partner to generate extra income to better their family living conditions. In business for approximately three years, she is excited to be taking her seventh loan from Esperanza International to buy fabric and other materials to produce children's, women's and men's underwear for sale.

Maria will reinvest her profits in her business and buy some furniture that her son needs. Maria thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy fabric to produce underwear for sale.

loans.name: Faridah's Group

texts.en:
Faridah's group is comprised of 2 hardworking women. Faridah is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda. For the past 4 years, Faridah has been working hard to manage her rearing animals, from which she sells milk. 

To help expand her business, Faridah has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to build more rental houses, and will help Faridah to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. Faridah hopes that in the future she will be able to become a secretary. 

Faridah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Faridah's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to build more rental houses

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 30-year-old married man with two children living in a permanent house in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a retail shop that he started eleven years ago. He started with capital worth 1.5 million shillings and now it's worth 5 million shillings. 

In spite of his progress, Samuel is facing a problem of price fluctuation. His dream is to educate his children and diversify his business to include other general merchandise like millet flour. 

Samuel needs the loan to buy sodas for resale.

loans.use: to buy sodas for resale.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria, a 32-year-old businessman, lives in Juba where he is the married father of three children between the ages of six years and nine months, one of whom goes to school.

Victoria has been operating a mixed-food store for the past 10 months. Having heard about Finance Sudan from the loan officer’s market promotion, he is requesting a loan of 1000 SDG to purchase more items including sugar, rice, soap, and cooking oil. Within five years, Victoria hopes to build his own house, and he very much appreciates the efforts of Finance South Sudan in helping to uplift him from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more items including sugar, rice, soap, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Sunday lives in Yei. She runs a food stall, and has been in business for one year. She is 30 years old and has three children, all of whom are in school.

Sunday heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase sugar and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and beans.

loans.name: Angela Isabel

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Calceta se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Agustín, ciudad conocida por gente trabajadora y sus mujeres hermosas.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora  Ángela tiene 51 años, está casada y fruto de esta relación   tienen 5 hijos, los mismos que ya son mayores de edad pero dos de ellos  aun viven con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.
 
Ella tiene una tienda en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, leche, carnes y además también vende sabanas y productos Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), los mismos que también vende en su local aunque a veces cuando tiene tiempo sale a visitar a sus clientes cuando tiene que realizar los cobros ya que estos productos los deja a crédito, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00  hasta las 21h00, Tiene más de 7 años y le va muy bien cada dia aumentándolo con la ayuda de los créditos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar productos de primera necesidad, sabanas  y productos Avon. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 8 años  y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado a crecer un su negocio y su vida personal.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
In the beautiful city of Calceta, the communal bank San Agustin meets every 15 days.  This is a city that is known for its hardworking people and beautiful women.

Here we meet Angela, 51, who is married and has 5 children.  Her children are now adults, but two of them still live with her.  Her husband is a merchant.

Angela has a store in her house where she sells all types of products, such as: rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, vegetables, milk, and meat.  In addition, she sells bed sheets and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women).  She sells the Avon products in her store and, when she has time, she also goes out to visit her customers when she has to make collections, because she sells these products on credit.  She works every day from 6am until 9pm.  She has been doing this work for more than 7 years, and it is going very well; her business is expanding gradually with the help of these loans.

She will use this loan to buy basic consumer goods, bed sheets and Avon products.  She has been with her communal bank for 8 years, and she likes it because the loans have helped her to grow her business and improve her personal life.

Her goals are to continue to make progress with her business, and see her store continue to grow each day.

loans.use: to buy basic consumer products, bed sheets and Avon products

loans.name: Mariposas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARIPOSAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Santiago II, está compuesta por doce integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Silvia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de artesanía, tejido de mantas y mantillas, soldador y tienda de barrio, venta de deportivos, venta de dulces, venta de MP3 y MP4, venta de abarrotes, venta y reparación de celulares, venta de perfumes, venta de licores, tejido y venta de chompas.

La señora Silvia,  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una familiar. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de venta de licores que viene trabajando hace algún tiempo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de licores) que adquirirá de los proveedores y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio comercial. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive con sus padres.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
The communal association "Mariposas" (butterflies) will have its first loan cycle with the Santiago II branch of the microfinance institution Pro Mujer. The group consists of twelve members and is headed by a board under the presidency of Señora Silvia. The members of this communal association have businesses in the following sectors: sale of handicraft, weaving of blankets and towels, welder's workshop and store, sale of sports articles, sale of candies, sale of MP3 and MP4 players, sale of groceries, sale and repair of cell phones, sale of perfume, sale of liquor, knitting and sale of sweaters.

Silvia says that it is the first time she works with Pro Mujer and that she was invited by a relative to join the institution. Currently she has a liquor store, which she has been running for some time.

The loan that she now applies for will be used to increase her inventory (purchase of liquor) which she will buy from her suppliers and then sell in her vending place. This kind of work enables her to earn an income and support her family, because she lives with her parents.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the training sessions.

loans.use: to buy liquor.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en: Denis is a 45-year-old married man with five children who lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a retail shop where he has worked for 10 years. Denis started his business with capital worth 150,000 shillings and now it's worth 4 million shillings. His main challenges are fluctuating prices, inflation and customers who fail to pay bills on time. His dream is educating his children and expanding business into new markets. Denis needs this loan to buy sodas to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy sodas to sell to his customers.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 32 years old, married and lives in Hioma, Uganda. For the last two years, he has worked as a farmer and is proud of what his doing. His main challenge is fluctuating prices, which make it difficult to predict his profits and can result in a loss. He hopes to build a permanent house for his family and also venture into modern farming methods. James needs this loan to pay the workers who are cultivating his land.

loans.use: to pay workers who are cultivating his land.

loans.name: Sharifah

texts.en: Sharifah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has no children. She takes care of additional family members (old parents). Sharifah has a food venting business (restaurant). She has been in this business for five years, and she works seven days a week. Sharifah sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Sharifah has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more, bunches of bananas, cassava, peas, sweet potatoes, beef and rice. The main business challenges for Sharifah include seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked restaurant. Sharifah lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and market dues.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, beef, peas, rice, sweet potatoes and cassava.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in Yei. She sells food from a food stall, and has been in business for five years. She is thirty years old, and has two children; all of them are still in school. 

Jane heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase beans and tomatoes. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase beans and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Poderosas De Comaravi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PODEROSAS DE CUMARAVI” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Santiago II, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Lourdes. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de planta de zapatos, tienda de carnicería, venta de flores, venta de helado, venta de vestidos, cafetería, venta de chompas.

La señora Lourdes,  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de plantas de calzados que viene trabajando hace algún tiempo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de plantas de calzados) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio comercial. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijas.

En la fotografía se encuentra el esposo de la señora Petronila, quien vino a acompañar a su esposa.
texts.en:
The “PODEROSAS DE CUMARAVI” Communal Bank will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Santiago II regional hub. It is made up of nine members and is led by a board of directors chaired by Sra. Lourdes. The members engage in a variety of businesses such as: shoe sales, a meat market, flower sales, ice cream sales, clothing sales, a cafeteria and sweater sales.

Sra. Lourdes notes that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer and that she joined the institution on the invitation of a promoter. Currently she has a business selling footwear and has had it for some time.

The loan that she will take out is to increase her capital to buy footwear she will acquire from distributors and later market in her commercial space. This type of work enables her to generate resources to support her family. She is married and has five children.

In the photo, one of the member’s husband’s is shown. He came to accompany his wife.

loans.use: to purchase footwear.

loans.name: Francisco Santiago

texts.es:
Francisco vive en el distrito de Parcona, Ica, Perú; Parcona se caracteriza por tener uno de los atractivos turísticos llamado el Bosque de piedras, así como también su agricultura y la generosidad de sus pobladores como buen peruano ama nuestra comida	y uno de los platillos que más le gusta es el riquísimo “lomo Saltado, con mucho esfuerzo el logro terminar su profesion el es profesor de Historia

Francisco es chofer de taxi, le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 12 horas al día y puede atender hasta 50 clientes en el día, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y amable con los clientes y sobre todo muy colaborador en especial con las personas mayores, las mujeres embarazadas y las mamas que tienen niños pequeños.

Francisco está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado el podrá realizar mantenimiento y reparación a vehículo con ello manejara con seguridad y le permitirá seguir trabajando para poder cumplir su gran sueño:” comprarse un vehículo”.
texts.en:
Francisco lives in the Parcona district of Ica, Perú. Parcona is known for having a tourist attraction called the Bosque de piedras (rock forest), and also for its agriculture and generosity of its citizens.  Like a good Peruvian he loves our food and one of his favorite dishes is the delicious "lomo saltado".  With much effort he was able to finish school, he is a History teacher. 

He is a taxi driver.  He works about 12 hours per day, servicing up to 50 customers a day.  He thinks that his business is doing well because he is very responsible and kind to his customers.  Above all he is very helpful to older people, pregnant women, and mothers with small children.

He is very thankful to the Kiva lenders for the support they have given him to be able to repair and do maintenance on his vehicle.  This way he will drive safely and be able to keep working to fulfill his great dream: "to buy himself a car".

loans.use: to repair and pay for maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Clare's Group

texts.en:
Clare's group is comprised of four hard working women. Clare is twenty-one years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is single and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Clare has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells phone accessories. 

To help expand her business, Clare has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more phone accessories for resale, and will help Clare to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Clare hopes that in the future she will be able to became a big business woman. 

Clare is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Clare's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more phone accessories to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is forty-five years old, married, and blessed with four children. She owns rental houses, a business she ventured into six years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. She has requested a loan worth KES 30,000 to purchase materials to renovate the properties. 

The profit earned will help her expand her business. Her dream is to see her business grow into a real estate business. This is her second loan.

loans.use: To purchase materials to renovate her rental properties.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Yei. She sells fish, and has been in business for two years. She is thirty years old, and has four children; three of them are still in school. 

Rose heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Sehbaly

texts.en:
Sehbaly is 18 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is single and a high school graduate. 

For the past five years she has been selling used shoes in the local market. She started this business with help from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used shoes for her business. She plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more used shoes for her business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is single, 24 years old and lives in the town of Nakuru, where he has worked as a butcher for the last two years. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use it to buy four sheep to slaughter in his shop. In the future, Samuel hopes to open up another butcher shop in his neighboring town.

loans.use: to buy four sheep for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Yei. She sells clothes, and has been in business for five years. She is thirty-two years old, and has three children; all of them are still in school. 

Susan heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to buy a car in future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Naomi's Group

texts.en: Naomi is 39 years old and the hard-working mother of one child. She lives with her child and husband in their own apartment in Kutre, a suburb of Berekum in the region of Brong Ahafo. She earns a living by trading in women's and men’s clothing. She buys her stock in the town of Kumasi and brings it to Berekum to sell. Naomi has been in this business for more than seven years and wants to use this loan to buy more clothing. She hopes to expand her business and increase her profit margins. She belongs to a community group called Agents.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Vitalyi

texts.ru:
Виталий – семейный человек. Вместе с супругой и двумя маленькими детьми он живет в селе Водяное. Виталий занимается выращиванием ранних овощей в своих теплицах. У него есть большой участок земли, три большие теплицы 80х10 метров и две теплицы для рассады. Виталий занимается сельским хозяйством уже 13 лет. В хозяйство он уже вложил 110 000 гривен. Ежегодно затраты на семена и пленку составляют 43 000 гривен. 

Виталий планирует вложить 7 000 гривен из полученных от КИВА средств в закупку пленки, 10 000 гривен – в приобретение качественных семян и оставшиеся 3 000 гривен в удобрения для почвы. В планах у Виталия – построить собственный дом, купить еще земельный участок и продолжать расширяться с фермерским делом, увеличивая обороты. Виталий надеется воплотить все это в жизнь, ведь тепличное хозяйство очень перспективный бизнес для данного региона.   
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Vitalyi is a family man.  He lives together with his wife and two small children in the Vodyanoye village.  Vitalyi is involved in growing early vegetables in his greenhouses.  He has a large plot of land, three big, 80x100 meter greenhouses, and two greenhouses for seedlings.  Vitalyi has been involved in agriculture for 13 years.  He had invested 110,000 hryvnia into his business.  His annual expenses for seeds and plastic amount to 43,000 hryvnia.  Vitalyi plans to invest 7,000 hryvnia out of the money received from Kiva into a purchase of plastic, 10,000 hryvnia into a purchase of quality seeds and the remaining 3,000 hryvnia into fertilizers for the soil.  Vitalyi's plans are to build his own house, buy another land plot and continue to expand his farming business by increasing turnover.  He hopes for all this to come to fruition because greenhouse business is a very promising enterprise for this region.

loans.use: to buy plastic, seeds and soil fertilizers

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 30 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Parcona, Ica, Perú; Parcona se caracteriza por tener uno de los atractivos turísticos llamado el Bosque de piedras, así como también su agricultura y la generosidad de sus pobladores, es madre de 2 pequeños de 9 y 7 años, los cuales son su adoración y por los cuales ella trabaja duro para poder brindarles una mejor cálida de vida cada día; como buena peruana le gusta nuestra comida y por ello uno de los platos que a ella le gusta mucho es el riquísimo “locro”, Rosa solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar medicina veterinaria.

Rosa trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa, y también vende mazamorras arroz con leche entre otros, ella le dedica su trabajo alrededor de 4 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 40 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy luchadora y sobre todo que siempre atiende a sus clientes de manera amable	y carismática.

Rosa esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá comprar más mercadería (ropa temporada de verano) y con ello tener mayor variedad de productos y poder aumentar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando para cumplir su gran sueño:” Tener una Tienda comercial”.
texts.en:
Rosa is 30 years old, lives in the district of Parcona, Ica, Perú; Parcona is characterized by one of the tourist attractions called "El Bosque de Piedras" or "Stone Forest," at the same time also its agriculture and generosity of its people. She is the mother of two, ages 9 and 7 years old, which are her adoration and for which she works hard to be able to provide them with a better quality of life each day. Like a good Peruvian, she likes Peruvian food and for it one of the dishes that she likes a lot is the delicious "locro." Rosa only studied until the 5th grade of school, but she would have liked to study veterinary medicine.

Rosa works in her business selling clothes, and also sells rice porridge with milk among other things. She work her job around 4 hours daily and can serve up to 40 clients a day. She thinks her business is going well because she is very hardworking and mostly because she serves her customers in a kind and charismatic manner.

Rosa is very grateful to the kiva lenders. Thanks to their help she will be able to purchase more merchandise (summer clothing) and with that have a better variety of products and be able to increase her income. This will permit her to continue working to accomplish her great dream: "to have a commercial store."

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise.

loans.name: Reina Guadalupe

texts.es: Reina Guadalupe de cuarenta y dos años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos. Ella posee una panadería donde vende pan en variedad, es muy conocida en la zona y ya tiene mucha clientela pues su producto es el mas rico, de primera calidad y a precio accesible, además el servicio es único Reina siempre recibe a sus clientes muy amable y con una sonrisa en su rostro; es una mujer emprendedora y muy segura de lo que quiere, le gusta trabajar y estar siempre a la vanguardia con su negocio, piensa que lo fundamental para el éxito es la perseverancia y ella la posee es por eso que se decido a solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar harina por mayor, azúcar, levadura, leche, entre otros. Reina Guadalupe tiene la confianza que así podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Reina Guadalupe, 42 years old, lives with her life companion and her children. She owns a bakery that sells a variety of bread. It is very well-known in the zone and has gained many customers, since its products are very tasty, of 1st quality, and the prices are accessible. In addition, the service is unique.

Reina always receives her customers with friendliness and a smile on her face; she is an enterprising woman and very certain of what she wants. Reina likes to work and is always in charge of her business. She believes that the basis of success is perseverance and she has that. 

That is why Reina decided to approach INTEGRAL for a loan to buy wheat at wholesale, plus sugar, yeast, and milk, among other needs. Reina Guadalupe has confidence that in this way, she will be able to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy flour at wholesale, and sugar, yeast and milk, for baking bread to sell.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: This is 32 year-old Isatu. She is a widow, and has two children who are 5 and 2 years old. She has no additional dependents who live with her. In 2003, she opened a grocery store to make things easier for her family and her husband, whose monthly salary did not meet all their expenses. She works seven days a week for 10 hours a day, and earns about Le. 750,000 a month. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000 to buy five bags of sugar @ Le. 260,000, baked beans @ Le. 60,000, mayonnaise @ Le.160,000 and milk @ Le. 260,000. Isatu has already received a loan and successfully repaid it, and requires a new loan in order to improve her business and increase her monthly profits by Le. 500,000. In the future, she plans to raise enough money to finish the house her late husband  left for her. Later, she may rent it out. Isatu is hard working and very determined, and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Shalva

texts.en:
Shalva is forty-six years old. He lives in the village of Chikaani with his family: his wife – Lali and his seventy-two-year-old mother who is retired. Agriculture is the only source of the income for the family. They have a milk cow. Lali produces cheese and sells it locally to retailers of dairy products. Shalva grows melons and nut-trees on the family-owned plot of land. He sells harvested products on the local market to retailers of greengrocery products. The total average monthly income of the family is 600 Laris, including Shalva's mother's pension.  

Shalva requested credit to pay for land cultivation expenses. He will pay a tractor owner for this service and will also purchase melon seeds. After proper cultivation and purchase of quality seeds the family will get a good harvest, which will be sold for a good price. They will get more income than in previous years and so will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation services and purchase melon seeds.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony has worked in the transport industry in Nakuru town for the last three years. He is twenty-six years old, married to Tabitha, and they have three children. 

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by his friend and this will be his first loan. He will use the amount to add to his savings and purchase a motorcycle

In future, Anthony hopes to buy a pickup truck which he will use to transport goods to and from the market.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica lives in Yei. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for one year. She is thirty years old, and has three children; all of them are still in school. 

Monica heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is fifty years old and lives in Buchanan. She is a widow with seven children between the ages of seventeen and thirty-five. Two of them are in school and live at home, while the older ones are working and living on their own. 

For the past thirty-four years she has been involved in selling dried fish in the local market to her community. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dried fish for her business. She plans to buy a piece of land and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for her business.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru:
Сергей занимается выращиванием ранних овощей в теплицах. Он имеет богатый опыт, большой участок земли и много энтузиазма. Сергей выращивает помидоры, капусту. Недавно он начал выращивать клубнику. Это очень перспективный вид деятельности. Бизнес Сергея сезонный и основной доход приходится на май, июнь и июль. Остальное время года Сегрей занимается подготовкой почвы, ремонтом и улучшением теплиц, посадкой и уходом за растениями.

Сергей проист предоставить ему кредит в сумме 10,000 гривен на покупку семян, удобрений и пленки для теплиц. Он настроен оптимистично и намерен развивать свой бизнес дальше. К примеру, в следующем году он хочет построить еще одну теплицу.
texts.en: Sergei is involved in growing early vegetables in greenhouses.  He has a rich experience, large plot of land and a lot of enthusiasm.  Sergei grows tomatoes and cabbage, and recently started to grow strawberries.  This is a very promising business.  Sergei's business is seasonal with the primary income coming in in May, June and July.  He spends the rest of the year preparing the soil, repairing and improving greenhouses, sowing and caring for the plants.  Sergei is requesting a loan in the sum of 10,000 hryvnia to buy seeds, fertilizers and plastic for greenhouses.  He has an optimistic outlook and intends to develop his business further.  For example, he wants to build another greenhouse next year.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and plastic

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru: Ирина занимается сельским хозяйством. Она выращивает овощи - помидоры, огурцы, перец, буряк - в теплицах. Этот бизнес является доходным и перспективным для данного региона. Он дает Ирине возможность содержать свою семью и удовлетворять ее потребности. Ирина просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 7,000 гривен на закупку семян, удобрений и пленки для теплиц. Ирине нравится тепличный бизнес и она планирует развивать его дальше.
texts.en: Irina is involved in agriculture.  She grows vegetables, such as tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers, and beets, in greenhouses. This is a profitable and promising business for this region. It gives Irina an opportunity to support her family and satisfy their needs.  Irina is requesting a loan in the sum of 7,000 hryvnia to buy seeds, fertilizers and plastic for greenhouses. Irina likes the greenhouse business and plans to develop it further.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and plastic for greenhouses

loans.name: Nieve Marina

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Calceta se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Agustín, ciudad conocida por gente trabajadora y sus mujeres hermosas.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Marina tiene 58 años, está casada y tienen 8 hijos todos mayores de edad, dos de ellos viven con ella y uno es niño especial. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, ella desde hace muchos años aprendió  corte y confección en una academia en la localidad.

Doña Mariana tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa, allí realiza muchos trabajos a personas que requieren de sus servicios y llegan hasta su taller para que les confeccione alguna prenda, confecciona todo tipo de ropa pero prefiere la ropa de damas ya que hay más diseños. Trabaja todos los días desde las 9h00 hasta las 18h00, y en ciertos casos hasta más tarde cuando tiene alguna prenda que entregar y sobretodo en épocas de entrada a clases ya que también elabora uniformes, en esos casos su hija le ayuda.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar telas, hilos, botones y otros materiales para la costura. Esta en el Banco Comunal hace cuatro años y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos. 

Su sueño es tener un gran taller de costura.
texts.en:
Every 15 days the communal bank San Agustín gets together in the beautiful city of Calceta; a city known for its hard-working people and beautiful women.

In this place we met Marina. She is 58 years old, is married and has 8 adult children. Two of the children live with her and one is a special needs child.  Her husband is a farmer. Many years ago she learned dressmaking at a school in town.

Marina has a small sewing workshop in her home. There she works on projects that people want her to do. They come to her workshop so that she may make them a garment. She can make all types of clothing but she prefers women's clothing because there are more designs available. She works everyday from 9:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. and sometimes later if she has a garment due and above all when school is starting because she also makes uniforms. In these times, her daughter helps her.

She is going to use this loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons and other sewing materials. She has been with the communal bank for four years and she likes it because of the ease of acquiring loans.

Her dream is to have a big sewing workshop.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en: Eric would like a loan to mulch his banana plantation. He is a farmer who is into commercial farming and mainly deals in bananas which is a common food delicacy in Uganda. He is a married man with ten children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He dreams of building a residential house, educating his children and diversifying his business in future to include a shop

loans.use: to rehabilitate his banana plantation.

loans.name: Elizbar

texts.en:
Elizbar is a twenty-seven-year-old farmer from the village of Vardisubani. He lives with his family: his wife – Nona, their two sons who are eight and three years old and his father. Nona is a housewife; Elizbar’s father works as electrician in a local company. Elizbar is leading the agricultural business of the family, which is the main source of the income for the family. He takes care of a milk cow and a calf. He produces cheese and sells it locally to retailers of  dairy products. He also has six sheep and sells lambs. Along with domestic animals the family owns 0.3 hectares of land, where vine-trees are grown. Elizbar produces wine and sells it on the local market. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris. 

Elizbar requested credit to purchase calves. He will raise calves during spring and summer and sell grown calves in fall for a higher price. The family will get additional income. Elizbar plans to use the increased income to create better living conditions for his children first of all, as well as for other family members.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
This is Gina, thirty-six, resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Engel, a welder, and is the mother of three children. Together with her husband, she manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Gina operates a market stall. She sells meat and vegetable products in the community market. She buys a quantity of meat and vegetables and sells it per kilo. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 36,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of meat and vegetables to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Gina dreams to be able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of meat and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Yuryi

texts.ru: Юрий выращивает ранние овощи в теплицах. В этот раз ему нужны дополнительные средства для установки отопления в теплицах, что позволит ему собирать урожай раньше и продавать его по более выгодной цене. Прошлый кредит Юрий использовал для закупки расходных материалов. Полученную прибыль он потратил на личные нужды, а часть вложил обратно в бизнес. Юрий намерен развивать свой бизнес дальше, увеличивая количество теплиц, а соответственно и прибыль.
texts.en: Yuryi grows early vegetables in greenhouses.  This time, he needs additional funds to install heating in greenhouses, which would allow him to gather the harvest earlier and sell it at a more profitable price.  Yuryi used his previous loan to buy various consumable materials.  He spent the received profit on personal needs and invested some of it into the business.  Yuriy intends to develop his business further by increasing the number of greenhouses and, therefore, increasing his profit.

loans.use: to install heating in greenhouses

loans.name: Zainura

texts.ru:
Зайнуре 53 года, замужем, воспитала четырех детей.  В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, Зайнура занимается животноводством. С 2002 года, стартовав с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS),  Зайнура смогла развить хозяйство с квартальной прибылью около 15,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день,  в ее хозяйстве насчитывается восемь овец и два ягненка. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зайнура обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы Зайнура планирует вложить в увеличение поголовья крупного рогатого скота.
texts.en: Zainura is 53 years old, married and raised four children.  She is involved in animal husbandry to provide a primary source of income for her family.  She started this business in 2002 with an initial sum of 10,000 som (KGS).  Zainura was able to develop her business to have a quarterly profit of about 15,000 som (KGS).  Today, her business has eight sheep and two lambs.  In order to further develop her business, Zainura requested a loan in the sum of 30,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy sheep.  She plans to invest the earnings into increasing cattle headcount.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: David

texts.en: David, aged forty-one, is a married man living in a semi-permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a farmer and deals in Irish potatoes and maize.He dreams of educating his children, building a permanent house and expanding his plantations. David wants a loan to buy Irish potatoes to plant.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes to plant.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in Yei. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for five years. She is thirty-five year old, and has five children; all of them are still in school. 

Grace heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,500 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Enago-Alo 1 Group

texts.fr: ENAGO-ALO 1 est un groupement composé de treize personnes, et dont les membres mènent les mêmes activités génératrices de revenus. La représentante du groupement, Thérèse (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 34 ans. Thérèse est mariée à un pêcheur du nom de Christophe. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux restent à leur charge. Thérèse vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Thérèse a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges,  Thérèse prépare depuis dix ans, différents mets (riz, haricot, accompagné de sauce) qu’elle vend dans on quartier.  De façon secondaire, Thérèse  vend des poissons frais. Thérèse s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d’agrandir son activité pour être plus compétitive sur le marché, Thérèse sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement ENAGO-ALO 1, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
ENAGO-ALO 1 is a group composed of thirteen persons whose members run the same revenue-generating businesses. The group’s representative, Thérèse (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 34 years old. She is married to a fisherman by the name of Christophe. They have five children, all in school. Two of the children are still in their care. Thérèse lives together with her husband and children. The couple jointly ensures that the diverse household expenses are covered.

Thérèse halted her studies in primary school. To cope with her different expenses, she has been making different dishes (rice, beans, served with sauce) for ten years. She sells the food in her neighborhood. On the side, she sells fresh fish. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

With the goal of expanding her business to become more competitive in the market, Thérèse, along with the other members of her group ENAGO-ALO 1 is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé. The first three loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and beans, some sauce condiments, and fresh fish.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo es un hombre luchador y sobre todo amante del trabajo y de salir adelante, es casado y j8unto a su esposa tienen un pequeño de un año de edad por el cual ambos dan la vida y es su motor para salir adelante, viven en la ciudad de Camaná , ciudad que se caracteriza por su agricultura en especial el cultivo de Arroz, así como también por sus hermosas playas y por la generosidad de sus pobladores, uno de sus pasatiempos favoritos es pasear por la playa porque el nos comenta que le da paz y tranquilidad, como buen peruano le gusta mucho la comida peruana y uno de los platillos favoritos de pablo es el riquísimo “Arroz Chaufa”, por motivos de pocos recursos económicos de sus padre el solo pudo estudiar hasta el sexto grado de primaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar “Ingeniería Mecánica”.

Pablo es conductor de mototaxi, le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 13 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 50 clientes en el día, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque lo hace con gusto y porque sabe que tiene que llevar un pan a su hogar en especial porque tiene un pequeño y el necesita muchos cuidados.

Pablo está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que con la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá darle mantenimiento a su vehículo de trabajo y con ello su vehículo será más seguro y no tendrá desperfectos cuando él lo conduzca, para así seguir trabajando y cumplir su más grande sueño:” Construir su casa de materiales adecuados para vivir”.
texts.en:
Pablo is a battler and above all he loves to work and to get ahead. He is married and he and his wife have a small child, 1 year old, that they care for and this is their motive for wanting to advance. They live in the city of Camana, a city characterized by its agriculture, especially for cultivating rice, and for its beautiful beaches, and the generosity of its inhabitants. One of his favorite pastimes is to walk on the beach because he says it gives him peace and tranquility. Like a good Peruvian, he likes Peruvian food. One of Pablo's favorite plates is the very tasty “Arroz Chaufa”. Due to his parents' lack of economic resources, he could only study up to the 6th grade in primary school, but he would have liked very much to have studied mechanical engineering.

Pablo drives a moto-taxi, working around 13 hours daily. He can serve up to 50 customers in a day. Pablo thinks his business is doing very well, because he understands that he has to bring bread to his home, especially because he has a little one who needs their care.

Pablo is very grateful to Kiva lenders since with the help they offer, he will be able to maintain his work vehicle and make it safer without defects when he drives it. This will allow him to continue working and fulfill his grandest dream: to build a house with adequate materials to live in.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his moto-taxi.

loans.name: Andruga

texts.en:
Andruga is a 35 year old business woman who lives in Juba Nimule. She is married and has 3 children between the ages of 9 and 2. Two of them go to school. 

Andruga runs a clothing’s store business. She has been in the business for 4 years. She has 1 employee. Andruga heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients and outreach and promotion done by the loan officers. She is taking a loan of 1000 SDG to purchase more items like women's dresses, bags and other items. In addition to this business, Andruga has houses for rent as another source of income.

In 5 years time, Andruga hopes for growth in the size of her business, to have a good boutique.

Her major challenges include prizes offered from the wholesalers every day in the market.  

Andruga says that, she is happy for Finance Sudan’s support especially for women. It has really encouraged women's empowerment.

loans.use: to purchase more items like women's dresses, bags and other items.

loans.name: Perida

texts.en:
Perida lives in Yei.  She is 30 year old, and has four children; all of them are still in school. She has a food stall, and has been in business for five years.

Perida heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase onions and tomatoes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase onionsand tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 60-year-old priest living in Masindi, Uganda. He has been rearing pigs for three years and the business is very lucrative. 

Paul is requesting a loan to buy pigs to raise. He dreams of furthering his education and expanding his piggery project.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Diana's Group

texts.en:
Diana is a 43-year-old married woman who lives in her own apartment with her husband and one child. She sells charcoal and eggs but has inadequate working capital to run her business. Diana is a member of the Nsuro ("Fear Not") loan group. Group members guarantee one another to provide collateral to access the loan.

Diana will use her loan to purchase more bags of charcoal and more crates of eggs to sell. She believes her loan will help her increase her profit and enable her start a clothing business.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and eggs

loans.name: Mive Mawou Group

texts.fr: Le groupement MIVE MAWOU est composé de treize personnes qui appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Marguerite est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Marguerite est âgée de 34 ans et est mariée à un pêcheur du nom de Pierre. Marguerite est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés, mais seulement un reste à sa charge. Marguerite vit ensemble avec son mari. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Marguerite mène comme activité, la vente de divers produits (riz, conserves, savons) à son domicile. Marguerite exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d’année et s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Marguerite sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement MIVE MAWOU, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group MIVE MAWOU is composed of thirteen persons who belong to the same “tontine”. This is the second time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost its businesses. The group’s representative, Marguerite, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 34 years old and married to a fisherman by the name of Pierre. She is the mother of four children, all in school, but only one of the children remains in her care. 

Marguerite lives together with her husband. The various household expenses are covered by the couple. To do so, Marguerite runs a business selling a variety of goods (rice, canned foods, soaps) out of her home. She has been doing this work for about ten years and gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and her revenues, Marguerite, along with the other members of the group MIVE MAWOU, is requesting a second loan from ALIDé. The first loan was indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy various goods (canned foods, soaps, sacks of rice)

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia lives in Yei, South Sudan. She sells fish and has been in business for five years. She is 40 year old, and has four children. All of them are still in school. 

Emelia heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her fourth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2000 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 50 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and her husband is a social worker. The couple has four children between the ages of 20 and 31. Three of their children are attending college and living on their own, while the younger one is in school and lives at home. For the past 25 years, Francis has sold palm oil in the local market.

Francis is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. In the future, she plans to use her profit to help her children graduate from college.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is 40 years old and has have five children who are all still in school. She lives in Yei. For the past five years, Loice has sold charcoal. She heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this will be her third BRAC loan. 

Loice is requesting a 1,500 SDG loan from BRAC to purchase charcoal. She will use the extra income from her loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Vivomingbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe VIVOMINGBE est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Mahinou Zividjo est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Mahinou Zividjo est âgée de 59 ans et vit au Bénin. Mahinou Zividjo n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Mahinou Zividjo est une veuve et est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés dont deux restent à sa charge. Mahinou Zividjo vit seule avec ses deux enfants à charge. Afin d‘assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Mahinou Zividjo exerce depuis une vingtaine d'année, la vente des céréales dans son quartier. Mahinou Zividjo s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Mahinou Zividjo sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe VIVOMINGBE, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group VIVOMINGBE is composed of three persons who reside in the same district. This is the third time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost its businesses. The group’s representative, Mahinou Zividjo, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 59 years old and lives in Benin. She did not attend school. She is a widow and the mother of four children, all provided with schooling. Two of the children remain in her care. 

Mahinou Zividjo lives alone with her two children to support. To ensure that the diverse family expenses are covered, she has been selling grains for about twenty years in her neighborhood. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and her revenues, Mahinou Zividjo, along with the other members of the group VIVOMINGBE, is requesting a third loan from ALIDé. The first two loans were indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy grains

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is a 30-year-old businessman who lives in Juba Nimule. He is married with two children ages two and seven. One of his children goes to school. For the past two years, Lily has run a mixed-goods business. This is his only source of income and his major business challenge is the high cost of buying products from wholesalers. He does not employ anyone. Lily heard about Finance Sudan from a loan officer's promotion at the market.

Lily is requesting a 1,000 SDG loan to purchase more items such as sweets, pens, key holders, and other merchandise to sell. He hopes to build a house within the next five years. Lily has a lot of appreciation for the lenders who finance and support South Sudan.

loans.use: to purchase items such as sweets, pens, and key holders to sell

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru: Шерали 43 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он занимается изготовлением и гравировкой могильных плиток. Этим видом деятельности занимается 20 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения каменных плиток.
texts.en: Sherali is 43 years old. He is married and has three children. Sherali makes and engraves tombstones and has been doing this for 20 years. He is taking this loan to purchase stone slabs.

loans.use: to purchase stone slabs for engraving

loans.name: Liliana Rocío

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Calceta se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Agustín, ciudad conocida por gente trabajadora y sus mujeres hermosas.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Liliana. Ella tiene 42 años, está separada de su esposo  y tiene tres hijas, dos mayores de edad y otra de 16 años que está estudiando en colegio y es la que aun vive con ella.

Ella con la finalidad de salir adelante y ganarse el sustento diario tiene un almacén de repuestos, llantas y accesorios de automóviles en un local alquilado en el centro de la ciudad, en este lugar vive y tiene su negocio. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00. Compra los repuestos en Guayaquil y Santo Domingo. Lleva más de 12 años con su negocio y que gracias a esto ella ha podido salir adelante sola con sus hijas.

Este crédito lo va a ocupar en comprar repuestos, llantas y accesorios para carros. Esta en el Banco Comunal hace cinco años, es la  fiscal de pago y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido y cumplido.
 
Sus sueños son tener una y un local propio.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the San Agustín Communal Bank meets in the beautiful city of Calceta, known for its hardworking people and beautiful women.
 
This is where Liliana lives. She is 42 years old, is separated from her husband, and has three daughters. Two of the daughters are grown and the other is 16, in high school, and is the only one who still lives with Liliana.

With the goal of getting ahead and earning her daily living, Liliana has a shop selling spare parts, tires, and accessories for cars. She rents a place downtown where she lives and has her business. She works every day from 8:00 until 5:00. She buys the parts in Guayaquil and Santo Domingo. She has operated her business for more than 12 years, and thanks to this she has been able to make ends meet on her own with her daughters.

She will use this loan to purchase spare parts, tires and accessories for cars. She has been in the communal bank for five years, and is the group's payment officer. She likes the communal bank because the people are very united and polite.
 
Her dream is to have a place of her own.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts, tires, and accessories for cars.

loans.name: Yover Fernando

texts.es:
Yover es un joven muy entusiasta y trabajador, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por hermosas playas, por su clima cálido y por uno de los atractivos turísticos más hermosos de nuestro país que son las islas ballestas y el candelabro.

Yover trabaja como chofer de mototaxi desde hace 7 años, anteriormente el tenia la necesidad de alquilar una moto para trabajar pero poco a poco y mientras más se esforzaba fue ahorrando dinero y logro comprar una moto, la cual también con mucho esfuerzo termino de pagar, el es muy dedicado, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy respetuoso con los clientes y porque no desperdicia su tiempo sino más bien lo aprovecha trabajando al máximo.

Yover está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda el podrá comprar repuestos para realizar el mantenimiento a su vehículo como llantas, rodajes, entre otros, lo que le permitirá tener un vehículo en bues estado y seguir conduciendo con seguridad tanto para el como para sus clientes, con ello seguirá trabajando para cumplir su gran sueño:” Tener una empresa de Transporte”.
texts.en:
Yover is a very enthusiastic and hard-working young man.  He lives in the city of Pisco, a city that is known for its beautiful beaches, a warm climate, and one of the most beautiful tourist attractions of our country, the Ballestas Islands and the Candelabro.

Yover has worked as a “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) driver for seven years.  He used to have to rent a mototaxi to work.  However, with great effort he was gradually saving money, and he managed to buy a mototaxi.  With great effort he also finished paying for it.  He is very committed.  He believes that it is going very well for him in his business because he is very respectful of his customers, and he does not waste his time.  He takes advantage of his time to work to the maximum.

Yover is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to their help he will be able to buy replacement parts like tires and wheels, among others, to perform maintenance on his vehicle.  This will allow him to have a vehicle that is in good shape.  He will be able to continue driving safely as much for himself as for his passengers.  He will continue working to fulfill his big dream:  “To have a transportation company."

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 57 years old. She lives in the village of Kisiskhevi, East Georgia, with her son, 37-year-old George. Nino is a widow. 

Nino and George earn a living through agriculture. They have milk cows. Nino produces cheese and sells it in the village. George has a truck. He takes wood from the forest and sells it in his village and nearby villages. The total average monthly income of the family is 500 Laris.

George has to change the tires of his truck, as the existing ones are old and it is already risky to drive in the forest. For this reason, George has stopped operations. Nino requested credit for purchasing four new tires for the truck. After changing the tires, George will be able to continue transportation and sales of wood. Nino and George will get planned income again.

loans.use: to purchase tires for her son's truck.

loans.name: Sayram

texts.ru: Сайрам более пяти лет занимается шитьем. Она в основном шьет национальные платья на заказ. Ей 50 лет. Она разведена. У нее трое детей. Она берет кредит для приобретения ниток и тканей.
texts.en: Sayram has been involved in sewing for over five years.  She primarily sews national dresses to-order.  Sayram is 50 years old, divorced and has three children.  She is requesting this loan to purchase threads and fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase threads and fabrics

loans.name: Alexander Alfredo

texts.es:
Alexander es un joven de 25 años, vive en el distrito de Parcona, Ica Perú, se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido en cualquier época del año, así como también por su agricultura y sus por la generosidad de sus pobladores, la comida peruana es muy deliciosa por ello uno de los platos que le gusta mucho es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo”, por motivos económicos solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria.

Alexander trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, le dedica a su labor alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 40 clientes en el día, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y honrado con los clientes.

Alexander agradece a los prestatarios Kiva porque con la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá reparar y realizar mantenimiento a su vehículo, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando para cumplir su gran sueño:” Comprar un auto”.
texts.en:
Alexander, 25, is a young man living in Parcona in Ica district in Peru, known for having a warm climate all year long, as well as for its agriculture and the generosity of its people. Peruvian food is very delicious, and one of Alexander's favorite dishes is "Arroz con Pollo" [Rice with Chicken] which is very rich. For economic reasons, Alexander could only go to school up to the fifth grade.

Alexander drives a motorcycle taxi. He works about 10 hours a day and can drive up to 40 customers in a day. He believes his business is going well because he is very responsible and honest with his customers.

Alexander is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the help they have offered he will be able to repair and maintain his vehicle, which will allow him to continue working toward his grand dream: to purchase a car.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle and purchase parts to maintain it

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ingredients with which to make cheese.

loans.name: Plan De Lucha 3 Group

texts.en:
Claritza is one of the members of the Plan de Lucha (Battle Plan) Group 3, located in the city of Hato Mayor, a primarily agricultural region. It is one of the most rural cities in the Dominican Republic. Her primary activity is selling underwear. Claritza is the mother of two children, who live with her and her father. She tells us that her biggest challenge has been working to help her children get ahead. Her favorite activity is tending to her business.

Claritza is very excited to receive her fifth loan through Esperanza Internacional, after having successfully repaid her previous loan. This was a step toward making her business grow. She has had her business for about four years. She started it with a small amount of savings and with her initiative to generate income and be useful.

Claritza plans to invest this new loan by purchasing underwear for men and women; she is planning to start selling them in wholesale quantities. She plans to use her earnings to reinvest in her business and save. Her dream is to have a well-established business. She thanks all of you for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy underwear.

loans.name: Shalom 2 Group

texts.en:
Lucia is the coordinator of the group "Shalom 2" named like this in honor to the biblical word. This group is located in Hato Mayor city, in the eastern part of the country. The group includes 5 micro-business people who sell clothes, natural products, shoes, food, etc.

Lucia's family includes herself, her long-term partner and two children from six they have. She is very excited to receive her 10th loan with Esperanza Internacional after having duly repaid her previous loan and taken steps to grow her business. She has had her business for about four years. She started it when she took her first loan.

Lucia plans to invest her new loan in her business. She is running a Cafeteria, where she sells sandwiches, juice, and other snack food. She will use her business profits to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy meat, ham, cheese, bread, salad, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Saidi

texts.ru: Саид проживает а Яванском районе. Он более семи лет занимается скотоводством. Ему 44 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Саид берет кредит для закупа несколько голов мелко - рогатого скота.
texts.en: Said lives in the Yavan district.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for over seven years.  He is 44 years old, married and has four children.  Said is requesting this loan to buy several heads of small livestock.

loans.use: to buy several heads of small livestock

loans.name: Verónica Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Verinica, habita en Nueva Guinea, es una mujer progresiva y trabajadora que con pequeños financiamientos ha podido mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, se desempeña como Docente de Educacion Primaria de esa misma ciudad, siendo su pricipal actividad economica, su esposo trabaja en actividades agricolas lo que le  permite colaborar en los gastos familiares, requiere de su 4to credito para invertirlo en la elaboracion de un corredor, por lo tanto gozara de mejores condiciones de vida en su casa de habitacion, referencias en su localidad la consideran como una persona responsable, de buenas culturas, espera ser beneficiado con este financiamiento para poder llevar a cabo su proyecto anhelado.
texts.en: Doña Veronica, a resident of Nueva Guinea, is a progressive and hard-working woman who has been able to improve her family's living conditions through small loans. She is an elementary school teacher in the town. This is her main job. Her husband does agricultural labour, which allows him to help out with the household costs. Veronica is requesting her fourth loan to invest in making a hallway. This will provide better living conditions in her home. Her references from her community say that she is responsible and polite. She hopes that this loan will be of benefit to her so that she can complete this project.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Yanilda Del Socorro

texts.es: Yanilda de 40 años de edad es casada, habita junto a su familia en Santo Domingo, donde tiene su propio negocio de pulperia, donde vende productos para el consumo familiar como arroz, frijoles, aceite y otras cositas que en el hogar hagan falta.  Esta solicitando su credito con el objetivo de invertir en su negocio para tener variedad de productos que ofrecerle a sus clientes.  Yanilda se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora y con muchos deseos de mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en: Yanilda is 40 years old and married. She lives together with her family in Santo Domingo where she has her own grocery store. There she sells products for family use like rice, beans, oil, and other items that the household might lack. She is asking for her 9th loan to invest in her business in order to have a variety of products to offer to her clients. Yanilda is a enterprising and hardworking woman with big dreams of improving conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Mawudekon Nonlome Group

texts.fr: Le groupement MAWUDEKON NONLOME est composé de dix huit membres qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin et font ensemble de la tontine. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Rufine, est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour la deuxième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Rufine est âgée de 46 ans et vit au Bénin. Rufine est mariée à un certain Richard et a deux enfants, tous scolarisés, dont un n’est plus à sa charge. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Rufine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de son enfant encore à sa charge, Rufine vend des tissus et des ustensiles de cuisine de façon secondaire par le système de distribution. Rufine mène cette activité depuis sept ans et s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Rufine et les autres membres du groupe MAWUDEKON NONLOME sollicitent un crédit deuxième auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en:
The MAWUDEKON NONLOME group is made up of eight members who all live in the same neighborhood in Benin and make up a savings group.  The group representative, named Rufine, is the woman with her hand raised in the photo.  With the goal of expanding their business activity in order to better satisfy their customers' needs, this group is requesting financial support for the second time through ALIDé.  

Rufine is 46 years old and lives in Benin.  She is married to a man named Richard and has two children, both of whom have attended or are still in school and one of whom is no longer under her care.  The couple shares the family's various expenses.  Rufine did not go to school.  To meet her needs and the needs of the child still in her care, she sells fabric and kitchen utensils on the side through a distribution system.  Rufine has been in this business for seven years and buys her products in a market in Benin.  With the goal of strengthening their business and better serving their customers, Rufine and the other members of the MAWUDEKON NONLOME group are requesting a second loan through ALIDé.  Their goal is to expand their business activity.

loans.use: to buy fabric and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru: Мухайё проживает в районе Яван. Ей 33 года. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Мухайё занимается торговлей семян овощей. Этим видом бизнеса занимается три года. Кредит берет для покупки семян других видов овощей и зелени.
texts.en: Muhayo lives in the Yavan district.  She is 33 years old, married and has three children.  Muhayo is involved in selling vegetable seeds.  She has been in this business for three years.  She is requesting this loan to buy other vegetable and herb seeds.

loans.use: to buy vegetable and herb seeds

loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.ru: Дилфуза занимается скотоводством. Она в основном занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности занимается 11 лет. Ей 28 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Дилфуза берет кредит для закупа несколько голов овец и коз. Кроме того она намерена часть полученного кредита отдать своему мужу для приобретения инструментов. Ее муж дома открыл цех, где занимается изготовлением дверей.
texts.en: Dilfuza is involved in animal husbandry.  She primarily breeds cattle and has been in this business for 11 years.  She is 28 years old, married and has three children.  Dilfuza is requesting this loan to buy several heads of sheep and goats.  Besides this, she intends to give a portion of this loan to her husband in order to purchase tools.  Her husband opened a workshop at home, where he manufactures doors.

loans.use: to buy several heads of sheep and goats, and to buy tools

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

Margaret has a business of selling sugarcane. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Margaret sells her products in a shop, by means of wholesale. Margaret has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bundles of sugarcane. She gets additional income through sweeping in Kampala Capital City Authority. The main business challenges for Margaret include seasonality and thieves. Her goal and aspiration for her business is to start going to villages for sugarcane. Margaret lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bundles of sugarcane

loans.name: Dinara

texts.ru:
Динаре 45 лет, вдова, имеет троих детей, младшему из которых – шесть лет.  В качестве дохода для своей семьи, Динара развивает животноводство и земледелие. Стартовав с суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS), Динара  смогла развить хозяйство, насчитывающее на сегодня одну дойную корову, одного теленка,  десять овец  и одну лошадь. Также, Динара обрабатывает 1,6 га орошаемой земли, где выращивает фасоль и картофель.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Динара обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы Динара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Dinara is 45 years old, a widow and has three children, the youngest of whom is six years old.  To provide an income source for her family, Dinara is involved in animal husbandry and farming.  Having started with a sum of 15,000 som (KGS), she was able to develop her business to currently have one dairy cow, one calf, ten sheep and one horse.  Also, Dinara works on 1.6 hectares of irrigated land, where she grows beans and potatoes.  In order to further develop her business, Dinara requested a loan in the sum of 40,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy sheep.  She plans to invest the earnings into increasing her livestock headcount further.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Vidal Claudio

texts.es:
Vidal vive en la ciudad de chincha, Chincha es nombrado por la  cultura de los Chinchas, célebre por sus avanzados conocimientos de la agricultura y sus proezas marítimas. Hoy en día Chincha es una increíble mezcla de culturas, con una gran población afro-peruana, debido a los restos de un pasado indígena, y las influencias del imperio español. La ciudad, junto a otras ciudades cerca de la costa del Pacífico, fue dañada en el año 2001 y 2007, fechas en las que ocurrieron terremotos de fuerte dimensión, pero ha soportado como siempre lo ha hecho durante gran parte de su historia, como buen peruano le gusta mucho nuestra comida y uno de los platillos que más le agrada es la riquísima Carapulcra, por motivos económicos Vidal solo pudo estudiar hasta el tercer grado de educación secundarias pero le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser profesor.

Vidal trabaja como lustrador de zapatos, le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 7 horas al día y puede atender hasta 30 clientes al día, el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque le gusta realizarlo con esmero y es muy conocido.

Vidal está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva porque con la ayuda que le han bridado el podrá comprar un bolero nuevo (herramienta para lustrar zapatos), lo que le permitirá tener una mejor herramienta para que realice su trabajo y así seguir luchando para cumplir su sueño:” Ser Profesor”.
texts.en:
Vidal lives in the city of Chincha, named for the Chincha people, celebrated for their advanced agricultural knowledge and their seafaring prowess. Today Chincha is home to an incredible mix of cultures, with a large Afro-Peruvian population, due to the remains of an indigenous past and the influences of the Spanish empire. The city of Chincha, along with other cities near the Pacific coast, was damaged during the strong earthquakes of 2001 and 2007, but it has endured as it always has for the greater part of its history.

As a good Peruvian, Vidal loves his country's food, and one of his favorite dishes is "Carapulcra" [a rich, spicy potato stew with pork and chicken]. For economic reasons, Vidal was only able to go to school through the third grade, but he would have liked to study to become a teacher.

Vidal works shining shoes. He works about 7 hours a day, and can serve as many as 30 customers a day. He believes his work is going well because he likes to do his work with great care and he is very well known.

Vidal is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the help they have offered he will be able to purchase a new "bolero" (a tool for shining shoes), which will allow him to have a better tool to use for his work and so continue striving to reach his dream: to be a teacher.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and a "bolero" (a tool for shining shoes)

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina is 38 years old and lives in West Point, Liberia. She is married and has four children ages 8 to 22. They are in school and live at home. For the past 10 years she has been selling fashion hairpins, necklaces, and many other items in the market. She has a lot of customers and makes a lot of profit. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fashion hairpins, necklaces, and many other items for her business. She plans to expand her business and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion hairpins, necklaces, and many other items for her business

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has six children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family. Christine has a business of selling fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for seven years, and she works seven days out of every week. Christine sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Christine has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of tomatoes, oranges, and mangoes. She also generates additional income through poultry farming.

The main business challenges for Christine include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going to villages for fruits and to become a wholesaler. Christine lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of tomatoes, oranges, mangoes, onions, and cabbages

loans.name: "les Merveilles De Dieu" Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "LES MERVEILLES DE DIEU" est composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité.
